title: ECCV_2016_110_abs

sentences.text: Recent progress in computer vision has been driven by high-capacity models trained on large datasets .
Unfortunately , creating large datasets with pixel-level labels has been extremely costly due to the amount of human effort required .
In this paper , we present an approach to rapidly creating pixel-accurate semantic label maps for images extracted from modern computer games .

Entity-this_paper.label: this paper
Entity-this_paper.description: This paper presents a novel approach for rapidly generating pixel-accurate semantic label maps from images sourced from modern computer games, addressing the challenges of creating large labeled datasets in computer vision.

Entity-an_approach_to_rapidly_creating_p.label: an approach to rapidly creating pixel-accurate semantic label maps
aliases: an approach to rapidly creating pixel-accurate semantic label maps
Entity-an_approach_to_rapidly_creating_p.description: This approach refers to a method developed for efficiently generating precise semantic label maps at the pixel level from images sourced from contemporary computer games, addressing the challenges of labor-intensive dataset creation in computer vision.

mentions.local_name: an approach to rapidly creating pixel-accurate semantic label maps

Entity-creating_large_datasets_with_pixe.label: creating large datasets with pixel-level labels
aliases: creating large datasets with pixel-level labels
Entity-creating_large_datasets_with_pixe.description: Creating large datasets with pixel-level labels refers to the process of generating extensive collections of images annotated with detailed semantic labels at the pixel level, which is essential for training advanced computer vision models but is often hindered by the significant human labor involved in the labeling process.

mentions.local_name: creating large datasets with pixel-level labels

Entity-image_extracted_from_modern_compu.label: images extracted from modern computer games
aliases: images extracted from modern computer games
Entity-image_extracted_from_modern_compu.description: Images extracted from modern computer games refer to visual content sourced from contemporary video games, which are utilized in computer vision research to generate pixel-accurate semantic label maps.

mentions.local_name: images extracted from modern computer games

Entity-approach.label: approach
Entity-approach.description: The approach refers to a method for quickly generating pixel-accurate semantic label maps from images sourced from modern computer games.

Entity-image.label: images
Entity-image.description: The term 'images' refers to visual content derived from modern computer games that are used to create pixel-accurate semantic label maps in the context of computer vision research.

Entity-pixel-accurate_semantic_label_map.label: pixel-accurate semantic label maps
Entity-pixel-accurate_semantic_label_map.description: Pixel-accurate semantic label maps are detailed representations of images where each pixel is assigned a specific semantic category, enabling precise identification and classification of objects within the visual data.

Entity-pixel-level_label.label: pixel-level labels
Entity-pixel-level_label.description: Pixel-level labels are detailed annotations that assign a specific label to each individual pixel in an image, commonly used in image segmentation tasks to identify and classify different regions or objects within the image.

Entity-human_effort.label: human effort
Entity-human_effort.description: Human effort refers to the labor and resources expended by individuals to create large datasets with pixel-level labels, which is a costly process in the context of training high-capacity models in computer vision.

Entity-recent_progress_in_computer_visio.label: Recent progress in computer vision
Entity-recent_progress_in_computer_visio.description: Recent progress in computer vision refers to advancements in the field characterized by the development of high-capacity models that utilize large datasets for training, enhancing the capabilities of computer vision systems.

Entity-high-capacity_model.label: high-capacity models
Entity-high-capacity_model.description: High-capacity models refer to advanced machine learning models that possess a large number of parameters and are trained on extensive datasets to achieve significant performance improvements in tasks such as computer vision.

Entity-modern_computer_game.label: modern computer games
Entity-modern_computer_game.description: Modern computer games are interactive software designed for entertainment, typically played on various digital platforms and characterized by their engaging graphics, gameplay mechanics, and user interactivity.

Entity-computer_vision.label: computer vision
Entity-computer_vision.description: Computer vision is a multidisciplinary field of computer science that focuses on enabling machines to interpret and understand visual information from the world.

Entity-large_datasets.label: large datasets
Entity-large_datasets.description: Large datasets refer to extensive collections of data that are used for analysis, training machine learning models, and conducting research across various fields.

Entity-computer_game.label: computer games
Entity-computer_game.description: Computer games are interactive digital entertainment software designed for play on computers and gaming consoles, often involving graphics, sound, and user input.

summary: Recent progress in computer vision has been driven by high-capacity models trained on large datasets . Unfortunately , creating large datasets with pixel-level labels has been extremely costly due to the amount of human effort required . In this paper , we present an approach to rapidly creating pixel-accurate semantic label maps for images extracted from modern computer games .

Predicate-has_been_driven_by.label: has been driven by
Predicate-has_been_driven_by.description: The predicate 'has been driven by' indicates a causal or motivating relationship between the subject and the object, suggesting that the subject's development, change, or progress is significantly influenced or propelled by the object. It implies that the object serves as a key factor or force that contributes to the subject's current state or evolution.

Predicate-trained_on.label: trained on
Predicate-trained_on.description: The predicate 'trained on' indicates the relationship between a subject, typically a model or system, and an object, which is usually a set of data or information. It signifies that the subject has undergone a process of learning or adaptation using the data represented by the object, implying that the performance or capabilities of the subject are influenced by the characteristics and quality of the data it was trained on.

Predicate-requires.label: requires
Predicate-requires.description: The predicate 'requires' establishes a relationship between a subject and an object, indicating that the subject cannot be accomplished or completed without the involvement or contribution of the object. It signifies a dependency where the subject necessitates the object as a fundamental component or resource for its execution or realization.

Predicate-is_costly_due_to.label: is costly due to
Predicate-is_costly_due_to.description: The predicate 'is costly due to' establishes a relationship where the subject incurs significant expenses or resources as a direct result of the factors or conditions represented by the object. It indicates that the subject's high cost is attributed to the specific influences or requirements outlined in the object.

Predicate-has_been_costly_due_to.label: has been costly due to
Predicate-has_been_costly_due_to.description: The predicate 'has been costly due to' establishes a causal relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject has incurred significant expenses or resource consumption as a direct result of the factors or conditions represented by the object.

Predicate-presents.label: presents
Predicate-presents.description: The predicate 'presents' indicates that the subject is introducing, showcasing, or making known the object, which typically represents an idea, method, or finding. This connection implies that the subject is providing information or a demonstration regarding the object, often in a formal or structured manner.

Predicate-creates.label: creates
Predicate-creates.description: The predicate 'creates' indicates an action or process whereby the subject brings into existence or produces the object. It signifies a transformation or generation where the subject's capabilities, methods, or efforts result in the formation of the object, which is typically a tangible or conceptual entity.

Predicate-are_created_for.label: are created for
Predicate-are_created_for.description: The predicate 'are created for' indicates a purpose or intended use of the subject, linking it to the object as the specific goal or function that the subject serves. It implies that the subject is designed or developed with the object in mind, suggesting a relationship where the creation of the subject is motivated by the need to fulfill the requirements or characteristics of the object.

Predicate-is_for.label: is for
Predicate-is_for.description: The predicate 'is for' establishes a purpose or intended use of the subject in relation to the object. It indicates that the subject is designed, intended, or suitable for the object, highlighting a functional or beneficial connection between the two.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' establishes a hierarchical relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject is a specific instance or subset that falls under the more general category represented by the object. This relationship suggests that the object encompasses a wider range of entities or concepts, of which the subject is a part.
